Thousands Watch Live As Hummingbird Eggs Hatch
Eggciting times at Olives Hummingbird nest! It's been about 14 days since the last egg was laid. Allens Hummingbird eggs usually hatch after 14-17 days of incubation. Incubation starts after the last egg is laid. Once the first egg hatches, the 2nd egg will hatch within 24 hours from the first. The mother will feed both chicks regurgitated bugs for about 3-4 weeks before the little chicks fledge.

AI tools were used to help write this article. A big "thank you" goes out to Vicki for her keen observation in spotting the movement of the eagle chick in the fourth egg. The dark spot that was initially uncertain whether it was a pip or not has been confirmed as a pip. Upon reviewing recent footage from the live overhead camera, it's evident that the eagle chick is actively working on breaking free from its shell. Exciting times are on the horizon with the imminent hatching of the chick. Judging by the size of the pip, it could happen at any moment. Video - Watch A Beautiful Hummingbird Lay Her First Egg ðŸ¥°
In this video you will see Olive the Allens Hummingbird lay her first egg of her most recent clutch. The 2nd egg was laid April 5th. Hatch watch starts on April 19th 2025. When the eggs hatch, the young chicks are helpless and blind with dark skin and some white down. The chicks will remain in the nest for about 22 days before fledging. During that time and for several weeks after they fledge, the female feeds the chicks by regurgitating food into their mouths.

HULETTâ€”Jim Neiman says that the best-case scenario for his familyâ€™s timber mill at the base of the Bear Lodge Mountains is that it doesnâ€™t shutter. The Crook County sawmill in 2022 shrunk to one shift to survive hard economic times and a dearth of available timber. Three years later, there are what appear to be major industry tailwinds: a pro-logging presidential order , prospective tariff hikes on Canadian timber and now a U.S. Department of Agriculture Secretaryâ€™s order declaring an â€œemergencyâ€ to stimulate logging on 112.6 million acres of national forest.
